results.title: It: Chapter Two
results.headline_credit: Canada and United States of America, 2019
results.brief_description: 27 years after overcoming the malevolent supernatural entity Pennywise, the former members of the Losers’ Club, who have grown up and moved away from Derry, are brought back together by a devastating phone call.
results.description: 27 years after overcoming the malevolent supernatural entity Pennywise, the former members of the Losers’ Club, who have grown up and moved away from Derry, are brought back together by a devastating phone call.

results.title: It Follows
results.creator_credit: Two Flints, Northern Lights Films, Animal Kingdom, David Robert Mitchell, Michael Perry, Erik Rommesmo, Laura D. Smith, Kimberly Leitz, Rebecca Green and David Kaplan
results.brief_description: After carefree teenager Jay sleeps with her new boyfriend, Hugh, for the first time, she learns that she is the latest recipient of a fatal curse that is passed from victim to victim via sexual intercourse.

constellations_other.name: Electric Sound Supercut: composers and their distinctive other worlds
constellations_other.description: Electric sound is commonly associated with science fiction narratives for its auditory oddness, which has symbolised other worldly environments, the unconscious and the 1980s.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Two Flints, Northern Lights Films, Animal Kingdom, David Robert Mitchell, Michael Perry, Erik Rommesmo, Laura D. Smith, Kimberly Leitz, Rebecca Green and David Kaplan
results.description: After carefree teenager Jay sleeps with her new boyfriend, Hugh, for the first time, she learns that she is the latest recipient of a fatal curse that is passed from victim to victim via sexual intercourse. Death, Jay learns, will creep inexorably toward her as either a friend or a stranger. Jay’s friends don’t believe her seemingly paranoid ravings, until they too begin to see the phantom assassins and band together to help her flee or defend herself.

Jay’s friends don’t believe her seemingly paranoid ravings, until they too begin to see the phantom assassins and band together to help her flee or defend herself.

results.title: Isle of Dogs
results.headline_credit: Germany and United States of America, 2018
results.brief_description: In the future, an outbreak of canine flu leads the mayor of a Japanese city to banish all dogs to an island that’s a garbage dump. The outcasts must soon embark on an epic journey when a 12-year-old boy arrives on the island to find his beloved pet.

constellations_primary.name: Stop-motion and animation superstars
constellations_primary.description: Despite the ease of new technology and a legacy going back to the beginning of cinema, stop-motion animation techniques are as popular as ever.

constellations_other.name: Explosive footage
constellations_other.description: How the fireballs in the opening scene of Blade Runner connect to Fatboy Slim and Detective Pikachu.

results.description: In the future, an outbreak of canine flu leads the mayor of a Japanese city to banish all dogs to an island that’s a garbage dump. The outcasts must soon embark on an epic journey when a 12-year-old boy arrives on the island to find his beloved pet.

results.title: Iron Chef
results.brief_description: Iron Chef is a Japanese television cooking show produced by Fuji Television. The series, which premiered on October 10, 1993, is a stylized cook-off featuring guest chefs challenging one of the show’s resident “Iron Chefs” in a timed cooking battle built around a specific theme ingredient. The series ended on September 24, 1999, although occasional specials were produced until 2002. The series aired 309 episodes. Repeats are regularly aired on the Cooking Channel in the United States and on Special Broadcasting Service in Australia. Fuji TV will air a new version of the show, titled Iron Chef, beginning in October 26, 2012.

results.title: Ip Man
results.brief_description: A semi-biographical account of Yip Man, the first martial arts master to teach the Chinese martial art of Wing Chun. The film focuses on events surrounding Ip that took place in the city of Foshan between the 1930s to 1940s during the Second Sino-Japanese War. Directed by Wilson Yip, the film stars Donnie Yen in the lead role, and features fight choreography by Sammo Hung.

constellations_other.name: Little J & Big Cuz to Blade
constellations_other.description: Discover how some of the best indigenous works connect to comic book blockbusters and martial arts videogames.

results.title: Interview with the Vampire
results.creator_credit: Neil Jordan, David Geffen, Anne Rice, Sandy Powell, Dante Ferretti, Redmond Morris, Stephen Woolley and Geffen Pictures
results.brief_description: A vampire relates his epic life story of love, betrayal, loneliness, and dark hunger to an over-curious reporter.

constellations_other.name: Movies in movies in a movie museum
constellations_other.description: The 400 Porto-Arc 16mm projector used the first electric light ever invented, which was perfectly suited for movie projectors. This Constellation explores the movies where characters go to the movies, by two movie-obsessed directors.

results.title: Interstellar
results.creator_credit: Legendary Entertainment, Syncopy, Lynda Obst Productions, Mary Zophres, Nathan Crowley, Christopher Nolan, Jonathan Nolan, Emma Thomas, Lynda Obst, Joe DeWalt Brown, Joseph A. Zaki and Will Lucas
results.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2014
results.brief_description: Interstellar chronicles the adventures of a group of explorers who make use of a newly discovered wormhole to surpass the limitations on human space travel and conquer the vast distances involved in an interstellar voyage.

constellations_other.name: There is no Planet B
constellations_other.description: While the climate emergency is very real, inspiring thousands and thousands of students to strike, documentaries, animated movies and dystopian genre films have warned about a world ravaged by global warming.

results.title: Insecure
results.brief_description: Follows the awkward experiences and racy tribulations of a modern-day African-American woman.
results.description: Follows the awkward experiences and racy tribulations of a modern-day African-American woman.

results.title: Ingrid Goes West
results.brief_description: Ingrid becomes obsessed with a social network star named Taylor Sloane who seemingly has a perfect life. But when Ingrid decides to drop everything and move west to be Taylor’s friend, her behaviour turns unsettling and dangerous.

constellations_other.name: Reality TV me
constellations_other.description: Cult documentary Grey Gardens follows the everyday eccentricities of mother and daughter Big Edie and Little Edie. The women perform and speak candidly to the camera, and have been described as predecessors to reality TV stars.

results.title: Inglourious Basterds
results.headline_credit: Germany and United States of America, 2009
results.brief_description: In Nazi-occupied France during World War II, a group of Jewish-American soldiers known as “The Basterds” are chosen specifically to spread fear throughout the Third Reich by scalping and brutally killing Nazis.

constellations_other.name: Splicing history and silencing the lambs
constellations_other.description: With plastic strips coated with light-sensitive emulsions, film strips captured light and created moving pictures. In this Constellation we trace celluloid and splicing as plot device to serial killers, secrets agents and Super 8.

constellations_other.name: Analogue and digital film
constellations_other.description: Though technology has evolved since celluloid film strips were invented, contemporary filmmakers and artists still appreciate and celebrate the analogue in a digital world.

constellations_other.name: Movies in movies in a movie museum
constellations_other.description: The 400 Porto-Arc 16mm projector used the first electric light ever invented, which was perfectly suited for movie projectors. This Constellation explores the movies where characters go to the movies, by two movie-obsessed directors.

results.description: In Nazi-occupied France during World War II, a group of Jewish-American soldiers known as “The Basterds” are chosen specifically to spread fear throughout the Third Reich by scalping and brutally killing Nazis. The Basterds, lead by Lt. Aldo Raine soon cross paths with a French-Jewish teenage girl who runs a movie theater in Paris which is targeted by the soldiers.
